name: Waterton Glacier Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large clean rooms. Seperate bedroom from the living room with TV. Jacuzzi tub (unfortunately didn't work)in full bathroom with a seperate makeup area. Large rooms, 2 fireplaces. Rustic pine furnishings. Fridge and coffee maker included. It was #106, queen deluxe room for $124 (AMA rate)- off season. Go to the Kilorney Lodge restaurant--- by far the best food in town!
reviews.title: Beautiful property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at Waterton Glacier Suites our accomodations (Suite #112) weren't quite ready, so the front desk gave us directions to a cafe nearby. When we came back from a stroll around the village we found #112 is a suite, with living room, bath, dressing area and bedroom. There is a king-size bed in the bedroom and a pull-out sofa in the living room. The dressing area has a refrigerator as well. A slightly raised deck off the bedroom offers a view of the parking lot. Gas fireplaces in both living room and bedroom provide heat, if needed. A/C in bedroom is useful during very warm July afternoons. In the morning and evening, we opened doors at each end of suite and there was plenty of cool fresh air. There is a standing fan if the evening breeze is insufficient. Overnight we closed both doors and ran reduced A/C in bedroom only, closing off rest of apartment and locking outside doors. Furnishings are suitably rustic for the area and quite adequate for our needs
reviews.title: Nice Property in the Heart of Waterton Village

likes.disliked: — No dining room, slight moldy smell in some areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TV coverage has NBC and ABC channels, the ubiquitous CNN and Fox news channels and the standard Canadian fare.
reviews.title: Nice, but not very good at solving problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: Because #112 is near the office we received a strong wi-fi connection, but the manager told us that some rooms do not. Guests in those rooms are invited to bring their laptops down to the lobby to get a better signal.
reviews.title: Easy to find - look for the turquoise roof.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Bottom line: All was fine. Unfortunately, there is no dining room, although guests are givien a 10% discount at another lodge nearby and there are several other attractive looking restaurants a short stroll away.
reviews.title: First stay here, but won't be our last!

likes.liked: — The friendly front desk staff and the great bed.
likes.disliked: — No coffee maker in our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an excellent stay at this hotel. The rooms were clean, the service friendly and helpful. We booked a romantic package which was well worth the cost. We had a beautiful room with a kingsize bed and corner fireplace. The setting was fantastic with great views of the mountains. The hot breakfast in the lobby was an unexpected pleasure. They also served delicious lunches for a reasonable charge. The perfect place to stay while enjoying cross country skiing in the mountains.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I booked 4 days at this hotel to take a break from his hectic work schedule. We knew most of the town would be closed this late in the season, but were planning on simply relaxing anyways. The spacious deluxe suite is divided into three rooms, with a corner gas fireplace in both the living room & the bedroom. The microwave, coffeemaker and minifridge are always a bonus when staying mulitple nights. The bathroom had a whirlpool tub and in the bedroom, there is a sliding patio door, with chairs stored in the closet to sit outdoors. Staff were very friendly and helpful at this hotel, and also their sister hotel, The Bayshore Inn, where we enjoyed a delicious
reviews.title: Can't say enough good things!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: dinner & breakfast. Great location in the village & deer wandering by the windows!
reviews.title: What a pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is not on the lake, but is a great place to stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. The suites are very clean and well-appointed. The bed is comfortable. There is a bedroom, bath (jacuzzi tub) and living room. There is a "closet" with microwave and refrigerator -- along with the coffeemaker and coffee. We wouldn't stay any place else in Waterton.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property - Beautiful Setting"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We have made a couple of trips to Waterton and always stayed at the Kilmorey Lodge. Since it burned down in January 2009 we had to find other accommodations for our September trip. After reading all the reviews on Waterton Glacier Suites I was a little hesitant to book a room but did so anyway. We were not disappointed. The property not only met our expectations it exceeded them. None of the negative comments regarding staff, cleanliness, missing items, noise, etc were experienced during our stay. We will surely return to this wonderful place.
reviews.title: great place to be.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Manager appeared to be on a power trip. Was not pleasant or accomodating.
reviews.title: Did not like this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: At checkout, was surprised to be charged an extra amount (legitimate) The issue was solely with the immediate defensive posture taken by the guy at the desk. One question and he was off to the races, even telling me to leave the premises. My only conclusion is that this is a regular occurrence at this establishment, resulting in instant reactions by the staff, either that or this guy was a complete fool.
reviews.title: Major attitude Problems with reception. Huge chip on his shoulder.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009
reviews.text: I have stayed at hotels all across Canada and never have I been more upset with the service recieved. Yes the location and rooms were beautiful but that does not make up for how unhappy I am with the service.
reviews.title: Bad Service. Not About Pleasing Their Customers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009
reviews.text: I found the rooms to be over priced. The website advertised them at a price and once at the hotel we were given a higher price for the same room. My parents and I had booked the hotel room because we had wanted seperate rooms and a jacuzzi. When we arrived we found the jacuzzi to be merely a bath tub with jets and so noisy we couldn't use it.
reviews.title: Beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009
reviews.text: There were so many rules and penelties that it ruined the "we are about the customers" attitudes that hotels should have. The binder on the coffee table as we walked in had written on it "$100 fine if removed from hotel room". As I read in another review I felt that it was like being at a boot camp.
reviews.title: Overpriced.Bad attitude from receptionist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pluses: convenient location on side street; helpful staff; generally clean.
reviews.title: Nothing to Write Home About

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Minuses: terrible bed; worse pillow; lots of noise from upstairs (walking, flushing, etc.); nearly useless "living" room; tv location makes it impossible for two to watch comfortably; some walls are stained and tattered looking; no attention to cleaning details.
reviews.title: Nice but not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's OK, but I would try other options before I returned to this one.
reviews.title: Nothing But Pure Relaxation..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean, staff was great
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is in need of redecorating. The jacuzzi was small and old - not appealing so we did not try to use it. The living room was small and seemed stuffy. It did have a screen door, that when used with the sliding glass doors in the bedroom created a nice breeze.
reviews.title: Nice Room, Fab Staff

aka: Waterton Glacier Hotel Waterton Lakes National Park
description: The Waterton Glacier Suites is Waterton's newest and highest rated hotel. We have three different types of suites - Deluxe, Romantic and Loft Suites with two full bathrooms! This all suite property boasts a fireplace, jetted tub, mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, in room safes and heavenly bedding in all our rooms. We are located in the center of the village and we are a non-smoking property.
